> If workers do not have public ips, it will be more torturing.

Maybe we should not imagine what users' environment is, it will increase our cost. If users machine without public IP, how could they install python package? maybe they have whl package in their local, they could install by `pip install --no-index -f ./pkg_path pkg name`. maybe the have python package index in they network locally. maye the others balabala thing they could do. But I think the most general way is install according to `requirements.txt`. So maybe we should use `requirements.txt` first, and then think about other edge case like public IP, others package manager, multiple python version supported

The task of 0 points on the 1st can also be complemented normally.

The timing time is set to 0:00 every day, when complementing the number, choose 0:00 on the 1st, and 0:00 on the 5th.

Front-end processing deduplication
